Penyaluran Pinjaman Fintech Tumbuh Signifikan
04 Nov 2019, 15:14 by Yulistyne Kasumaningrum
BANDUNG, (PR).- Penyaluran pinjaman melalui fintech p2p lending terus menunjukkan pertumbuhan signifikan. Dai antaranya dicatatkan Akseleran yang hingga Oktober 2019 telah menyalurkan pinjaman senilai Rp 600 miliar atau tumbuh 319% dibandingkan periode yang sama tahun lalu.
Christopher Gultom, Chief Credit Officer & Co-Founder Akseleran mengatakan dari jumlah tersebut produk invoice financing dan pre-invoice financing masih memberikan kontribusi terbesar dengan lebih dari 85% dari total pinjaman yang sudah disalurkan. Sementara untuk sektor UKM sendiri, pada Oktober pihaknya menyalurkan total pinjaman usaha sebesar Rp71 miliar kepada 64 UKM kelas menengah di Indonesia.
“Secara kumulatif Akseleran sudah menyalurkan total pinjaman usaha hampir sebesar Rp800 miliar dan tetap on the right track untuk mencapai target di akhir tahun ini hingga sebesar Rp1 triliun. Selain itu, kami pun terus menjaga kualitas aset agar tingkat NPL dapat tetap di kisaran 1% dari total penyaluran di akhir tahun 2019,” ujar Christo, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Dari sisi sektor usaha, Christo mengatakan setidaknya ada tiga sektor UKM menengah yang sudah memperoleh akses pinjaman usaha dari Akseleran sepanjang Oktober 2019. Ketiga sektor tersebut yakni engineering atau construction (41%), coal & related energy (15%), dan business & consumer services (10%).
“Kami optimistis dapat terus tumbuh dan tetap berfokus kepada pinjaman usaha berbasiskan produk invoice financing dan pre-invoice financing ke depannya. Dan tidak hanya berkutat di DKI Jakarta saja karena hingga Oktober 2019 terdapat Top 10 Provinsi untuk yang sudah memperoleh pinjaman usaha dari Akseleran, antara lain Jawa Barat, Banten, Jawa Tengah, Kalimantan Timur, Jawa Timur, Yogyakarta, Bali, Sumatera Selatan, dan Maluku,” katanya. 
Di sisi lain, Christo memaparkan, untuk total nilai investasi dari para pemberi dana pinjaman Akseleran mencapai Rp70 miliar pada Oktober 2019. Jumlah tersebut naik 41% dibandingkan realisasi nilai investasi pada September 2019.
“Selain Pulau Jawa, provinsi lainnya terus meningkat, yakni Sumatera Utara, Kepulauan Riau, Bali, Sulawesi Selatan, Kalimantan Timur, Sumatera Selatan, Kalimantan Barat, Sumatera Barat, dan Jambi. Saat ini, kontribusi terbesar untuk pemberi dana pinjaman Akseleran masih berasal dari retail sebesar 90% dan sisanya adalah dari institusional,” ujarnya.***

Fintech Loans Distribution Significantly Growing
Nov 04 2019, 15:14 by Yulistyne Kasumaningrum
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Loan distribution through fintech p2p lending continues to show significant growth. Among other things, Akseleran noted that as of October 2019, it had disbursed loans worth Rp 600 billion or grew 319% compared to the same period last year.
Christopher Gultom, Chief Credit Officer & Co-Founder of Akseleran said that of the total invoice financing and pre-invoice financing products, the biggest contribution was more than 85% of the total loans disbursed. As for the SME sector itself, in October it distributed a total business loan of Rp. 71 billion to 64 middle-class SMEs in Indonesia.
"Cumulatively, Akseleran has channeled a total business loan of almost Rp800 billion and remains on the right track to reach the target by the end of this year of up to Rp1 trillion. In addition, we also continue to maintain asset quality so that the NPL level can remain in the range of 1% of total disbursement at the end of 2019, "said Christo, Monday, November 4, 2019.
In terms of the business sector, Christo said there were at least three medium SME sectors that had obtained business loan access from Acceleration throughout October 2019. The three sectors were engineering or construction (41%), coal & related energy (15%), and business & consumer services (10%).
"We are optimistic that we can continue to grow and continue to focus on business loans based on invoice financing and pre-invoice financing products going forward. And not only struggling in DKI Jakarta because until October 2019 there are Top 10 Provinces for which have obtained business loans from Acceleration, including West Java, Banten, Central Java, East Kalimantan, East Java, Yogyakarta, Bali, South Sumatra, and Maluku , "He said.
On the other hand, Christo explained, the total investment value of the Acceleration loan providers reached Rp70 billion in October 2019. The amount was up 41% compared to the realization of the investment value in September 2019.
"In addition to Java, other provinces continue to increase, namely North Sumatra, Riau Islands, Bali, South Sulawesi, East Kalimantan, South Sumatra, West Kalimantan, West Sumatra and Jambi. At present, the biggest contribution to accelerator loan providers is still from retail by 90% and the rest is from institutional institutions, "he said. ***
